section.title: BMesh Operators (bmesh.ops)
section.paragraph: This module gives access to low level bmesh operations.
Most operators take input and return output, they can be chained together to perform useful operations.

note.paragraph: This API us new in 2.65 and not yet well tested.

section.title: Operator Example
section.paragraph: This script shows how operators can be used to model a link of a chain.
section.literal_block:
# This script uses bmesh operators to make 2 links of a chain.
import bpy import bmesh import math import mathutils
# Make a new BMesh bm = bmesh.new()
# Add a circle XXX, should return all geometry created, not just verts. bmesh.ops.create_circle( bm, cap_ends=False, radius=0.2, segments=8)
# Spin and deal with geometry on side 'a' edges_start_a = bm.edges[:] geom_start_a = bm.verts[:] + edges_start_a ret = bmesh.ops.spin( bm, geom=geom_start_a, angle=math.radians(180.0), steps=8, axis=(1.0, 0.0, 0.0), cent=(0.0, 1.0, 0.0)) edges_end_a = [ele for ele in ret["geom_last"] if isinstance(ele, bmesh.types.BMEdge)] del ret
# Extrude and create geometry on side 'b' ret = bmesh.ops.extrude_edge_only( bm, edges=edges_start_a) geom_extrude_mid = ret["geom"] del ret
# Collect the edges to spin XXX, 'extrude_edge_only' could return this. verts_extrude_b = [ele for ele in geom_extrude_mid if isinstance(ele, bmesh.types.BMVert)] edges_extrude_b = [ele for ele in geom_extrude_mid if isinstance(ele, bmesh.types.BMEdge) and ele.is_boundary] bmesh.ops.translate( bm, verts=verts_extrude_b, vec=(0.0, 0.0, 1.0))
# Create the circle on side 'b' ret = bmesh.ops.spin( bm, geom=verts_extrude_b + edges_extrude_b, angle=-math.radians(180.0), steps=8, axis=(1.0, 0.0, 0.0), cent=(0.0, 1.0, 1.0)) edges_end_b = [ele for ele in ret["geom_last"] if isinstance(ele, bmesh.types.BMEdge)] del ret
# Bridge the resulting edge loops of both spins 'a & b' bmesh.ops.bridge_loops( bm, edges=edges_end_a + edges_end_b)
# Now we have made a links of the chain, make a copy and rotate it # (so this looks something like a chain)
ret = bmesh.ops.duplicate( bm, geom=bm.verts[:] + bm.edges[:] + bm.faces[:]) geom_dupe = ret["geom"] verts_dupe = [ele for ele in geom_dupe if isinstance(ele, bmesh.types.BMVert)] del ret
# position the new link bmesh.ops.translate( bm, verts=verts_dupe, vec=(0.0, 0.0, 2.0)) bmesh.ops.rotate( bm, verts=verts_dupe, cent=(0.0, 1.0, 0.0), matrix=mathutils.Matrix.Rotation(math.radians(90.0), 3, 'Z'))
# Done with creating the mesh, simply link it into the scene so we can see it
# Finish up, write the bmesh into a new mesh me = bpy.data.meshes.new("Mesh") bm.to_mesh(me) bm.free()
# Add the mesh to the scene scene = bpy.context.scene obj = bpy.data.objects.new("Object", me) scene.objects.link(obj)
# Select and make active scene.objects.active = obj obj.select = True

desc_content.paragraph: Smooths vertices by using a basic vertex averaging scheme.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
mirror_clip_x (bool) – set vertices close to the x axis before the operation to 0
mirror_clip_y (bool) – set vertices close to the y axis before the operation to 0
mirror_clip_z (bool) – set vertices close to the z axis before the operation to 0
clip_dist (float) – clipping threshold for the above three slots
use_axis_x (bool) – smooth vertices along X axis
use_axis_y (bool) – smooth vertices along Y axis
use_axis_z (bool) – smooth vertices along Z axis

desc_content.paragraph: Smooths vertices by using Laplacian smoothing propose by. Desbrun, et al. Implicit Fairing of Irregular Meshes using Diffusion and Curvature Flow.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_x (bool) – Smooth object along X axis
use_y (bool) – Smooth object along Y axis
use_z (bool) – Smooth object along Z axis
preserve_volume (bool) – Apply volume preservation after smooth

desc_content.paragraph: Computes an “outside” normal for the specified input faces.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
iterations (int) – Number of times to flatten faces (for when connected faces are used)
factor (float) – Influence for making planar each iteration
geom: output slot, computed boundary geometry.

desc_content.paragraph: used to implement the select more/less tools. this puts some geometry surrounding regions of geometry in geom into geom.out.
if use_faces is 0 then geom.out spits out verts and edges, otherwise it spits out faces.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
geom (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert, bmesh.types.BMEdge, bmesh.types.BMFace)) – input geometry
use_contract (bool) – find boundary inside the regions, not outside.
use_faces (bool) – extend from faces instead of edges
geom: output slot, computed boundary geometry.

desc_content.paragraph: Rotates edges topologically. Also known as “spin edge” to some people. Simple example: [/] becomes [|] then [\].

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_ccw (bool) – rotate edge counter-clockwise if true, otherwise clockwise

desc_content.paragraph: Reverses the winding (vertex order) of faces. This has the effect of flipping the normal.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Splits input edges (but doesn’t do anything else). This creates a 2-valence vert.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
edge_percents (dict mapping vert/edge/face types to float) – Undocumented.
geom_split: newly created vertices and edges

desc_content.paragraph: Mirrors geometry along an axis. The resulting geometry is welded on using merge_dist. Pairs of original/mirrored vertices are welded using the merge_dist parameter (which defines the minimum distance for welding to happen).

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
geom (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert, bmesh.types.BMEdge, bmesh.types.BMFace)) – input geometry
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix defining the mirror transformation
merge_dist (float) – maximum distance for merging. does no merging if 0.
axis (enum in ['X', 'Y', 'Z'], default 'X') – the axis to use.
mirror_u (bool) – mirror UVs across the u axis
mirror_v (bool) – mirror UVs across the v axis

desc_content.paragraph: Takes input verts and find vertices they should weld to. Outputs a mapping slot suitable for use with the weld verts bmop.
If keep_verts is used, vertices outside that set can only be merged with vertices in that set.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
keep_verts (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert)) – list of verts to keep
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace

desc_content.paragraph: Finds groups of vertices closer then dist and merges them together, using the weld verts bmop.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Finds groups of vertices closer then dist and merges them together, using the weld verts bmop. The merges must go from a vert not in verts to one in verts.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
uvs (bool) – also collapse UVs and such

desc_content.paragraph: Merge uv/vcols at a specific vertex.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Merge uv/vcols associated with the input vertices at the bounding box center. (I know, it’s not averaging but the vert_snap_to_bb_center is just too long).

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Merge verts together at a point.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
verts (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert)) – input vertices (all verts will be merged into the first).
merge_co (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – Position to merge at.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Welds verts together (kind-of like remove doubles, merge, etc, all of which use or will use this bmop). You pass in mappings from vertices to the vertices they weld with.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
targetmap (dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace) – Undocumented.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a single vertex; this bmop was necessary for click-create-vertex.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
co (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – the coordinate of the new vert

desc_content.paragraph: Tries to intelligently join triangles according to angle threshold and delimiters.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: This is basically F-key, it creates new faces from vertices, makes stuff from edge nets, makes wire edges, etc. It also dissolves faces.
Three verts become a triangle, four become a quad. Two become a wire edge.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
geom (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert, bmesh.types.BMEdge, bmesh.types.BMFace)) – input geometry.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Create faces defined by 2 disconnected edge loops (which share edges).

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Fill boundary edges with faces, copying surrounding customdata.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
sides (int) – number of face sides to fill

desc_content.paragraph: Fill in faces with data from adjacent faces.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
faces_fail: faces that could not be handled

desc_content.paragraph: Create faces defined by one or more non overlapping edge loops.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Create faces defined by enclosed edges.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Identifies several useful edge loop cases and modifies them so they’ll become a face when edgenet_fill is called. The cases covered are:

list_item.paragraph: One single loop; an edge is added to connect the ends
Two loops; two edges are added to connect the endpoints (based on the shortest distance between each endpont).
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Rotate vertices around a center, using a 3x3 rotation matrix.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
cent (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – center of rotation
space (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to define the space (typically object matrix)
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
vec (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – translation offset
space (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to define the space (typically object matrix)
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
vec (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – scale factor
space (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to define the space (typically object matrix)

desc_content.paragraph: Transforms a set of vertices by a matrix. Multiplies the vertex coordinates with the matrix.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
space (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to define the space (typically object matrix)

desc_content.paragraph: Loads a bmesh into an object/mesh. This is a “private” bmop.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Converts a bmesh to a Mesh. This is reserved for exiting editmode.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Load the contents of a mesh into the bmesh. this bmop is private, it’s reserved exclusively for entering editmode.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_shapekey (bool) – load active shapekey coordinates into verts
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Extrudes Edges into faces, note that this is very simple, there’s no fancy winged extrusion.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Split faces by adding edges that connect verts.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
check_degenerate (bool) – prevent splits with overlaps & intersections

desc_content.paragraph: Connect Verts to form Convex Faces.
Ensures all faces are convex faces.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Connect Verts Across non Planer Faces.
Split faces by connecting edges along non planer faces.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Split faces by adding edges that connect verts.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
geom (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert, bmesh.types.BMEdge, bmesh.types.BMFace)) – edges and faces
use_keep_orig (bool) – keep original geometry (requires geom to include edges).
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_verts (bool) – dissolve verts left between only 2 edges.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_verts (bool) – dissolve verts left between only 2 edges.

desc_content.paragraph: Dissolve planar faces and co-linear edges.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
delimit (set of flags from ['NORMAL', 'MATERIAL', 'SEAM', 'SHARP', 'UV'], default {}) – Undocumented.

desc_content.paragraph: Dissolve edges with no length, faces with no area.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
dist (float) – minimum distance to consider degenerate
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace

desc_content.paragraph: Reduce detail in geometry containing grids.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Advanced operator for subdividing edges with options for face patterns, smoothing and randomization.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
smooth_falloff (enum in ['SMOOTH', 'SPHERE', 'ROOT', 'SHARP', 'LINEAR', 'INVERSE_SQUARE'], default 'SMOOTH') – smooth falloff type
custom_patterns (dict mapping vert/edge/face types to unknown internal data, not compatible with python) – uses custom pointers
edge_percents (dict mapping vert/edge/face types to float) – Undocumented.
quad_corner_type (enum in ['STRAIGHT_CUT', 'INNER_VERT', 'PATH', 'FAN'], default 'STRAIGHT_CUT') – quad corner type
use_grid_fill (bool) – fill in fully-selected faces with a grid
use_single_edge (bool) – tessellate the case of one edge selected in a quad or triangle
use_sphere (bool) – for making new primitives only
use_smooth_even (bool) – maintain even offset when smoothing

desc_content.paragraph: Take an edge-ring, and subdivide with interpolation options.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
profile_shape (enum in ['SMOOTH', 'SPHERE', 'ROOT', 'SHARP', 'LINEAR', 'INVERSE_SQUARE'], default 'SMOOTH') – profile shape type

desc_content.paragraph: Bisects the mesh by a plane (cut the mesh in half).

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
dist (float) – minimum distance when testing if a vert is exactly on the plane
plane_co (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – point on the plane
plane_no (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – direction of the plane
use_snap_center (bool) – snap axis aligned verts to the center
clear_outer (bool) – when enabled. remove all geometry on the positive side of the plane
clear_inner (bool) – when enabled. remove all geometry on the negative side of the plane
geom_cut: output geometry aligned with the plane (new and existing)
geom: input and output geometry (result of cut)
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
context (enum in ['VERTS', 'EDGES', 'FACES_ONLY', 'EDGES_FACES', 'FACES', 'FACES_KEEP_BOUNDARY', 'TAGGED_ONLY'], default 'VERTS') – geometry types to delete

desc_content.paragraph: Utility operator to duplicate geometry, optionally into a destination mesh.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace

desc_content.paragraph: Disconnect geometry from adjacent edges and faces, optionally into a destination mesh.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_only_faces (bool) – when enabled. don’t duplicate loose verts/edges
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace

desc_content.paragraph: Extrude or duplicate geometry a number of times, rotating and possibly translating after each step

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
cent (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – rotation center
axis (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – rotation axis
dvec (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – translation delta per step
space (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to define the space (typically object matrix)
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
type (enum in ['MATERIAL', 'AREA', 'SIDES', 'PERIMETER', 'NORMAL', 'COPLANAR', 'SMOOTH', 'FACE_MAP', 'FREESTYLE'], default 'MATERIAL') – type of selection

desc_content.paragraph: Find similar edges (length, direction, edge, seam, …).

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
type (enum in ['LENGTH', 'DIRECTION', 'FACE', 'FACE_ANGLE', 'CREASE', 'BEVEL', 'SEAM', 'SHARP', 'FREESTYLE'], default 'LENGTH') – type of selection

desc_content.paragraph: Find similar vertices (normal, face, vertex group, …).

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
type (enum in ['NORMAL', 'FACE', 'VERTEX_GROUP', 'EDGE'], default 'NORMAL') – type of selection
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_ccw (bool) – rotate counter-clockwise if true, otherwise clockwise
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
use_ccw (bool) – rotate counter-clockwise if true, otherwise clockwise
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
verts (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert)) – optional tag verts, use to have greater control of splits
use_verts (bool) – use ‘verts’ for splitting, else just find verts to split from edges

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a grid with a variable number of subdivisions

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to multiply the new geometry with

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a grid with a variable number of subdivisions

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to multiply the new geometry with

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a grid with a variable number of subdivisions

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
subdivisions (int) – how many times to recursively subdivide the sphere
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to multiply the new geometry with
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to multiply the new geometry with

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a cone with variable depth at both ends

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
cap_ends (bool) – whether or not to fill in the ends with faces
cap_tris (bool) – fill ends with triangles instead of ngons
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to multiply the new geometry with
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
cap_ends (bool) – whether or not to fill in the ends with faces
cap_tris (bool) – fill ends with triangles instead of ngons
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to multiply the new geometry with
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
matrix (mathutils.Matrix) – matrix to multiply the new geometry with
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
geom (list of (bmesh.types.BMVert, bmesh.types.BMEdge, bmesh.types.BMFace)) – input edges and vertices
offset (float) – amount to offset beveled edge
offset_type (enum in ['OFFSET', 'WIDTH', 'DEPTH', 'PERCENT'], default 'OFFSET') – how to measure the offset
segments (int) – number of segments in bevel
vertex_only (bool) – only bevel vertices, not edges
clamp_overlap (bool) – do not allow beveled edges/vertices to overlap each other
material (int) – material for bevel faces, -1 means get from adjacent faces
loop_slide (bool) – prefer to slide along edges to having even widths
mark_seam (bool) – extend edge data to allow seams to run across bevels
mark_sharp (bool) – extend edge data to allow sharp edges to run across bevels
strength (float) – strength of calculated normal in range (0, 1) for custom clnors
hnmode (enum in ['NONE', 'FACE', 'ADJACENT', 'FIXED_NORMAL_SHADING'], default 'NONE') – harden normals mode used in bevel, if enabled
normals: output normals per vertex for beveled edges
type dict mapping vert/edge/face types to bmesh.types.BMVert/bmesh.types.BMEdge/bmesh.types.BMFace

desc_content.paragraph: Rotate edges to create more evenly spaced triangles.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
edges (list of (bmesh.types.BMEdge)) – edges that can be flipped
use_restrict_tag (bool) – restrict edge rotation to mixed tagged vertices
method (enum in ['AREA', 'ANGLE'], default 'AREA') – method to define what is beautiful
geom: new flipped faces and edges
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
normal (mathutils.Vector or any sequence of 3 floats) – optionally pass the fill normal to use

desc_content.paragraph: Turns a mesh into a shell with thickness

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates edge loops based on simple edge-outset method.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Makes a wire-frame copy of faces.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Splits a face into a triangle fan.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
offset (float) – center vertex offset along normal
center_mode (enum in ['MEAN_WEIGHTED', 'MEAN', 'BOUNDS'], default 'MEAN_WEIGHTED') – calculation mode for center vertex

desc_content.paragraph: Builds a convex hull from the vertices in ‘input’.
If ‘use_existing_faces’ is true, the hull will not output triangles that are covered by a pre-existing face.

All hull vertices, faces, and edges are added to ‘geom.out’. Any input elements that end up inside the hull (i.e. are not used by an output face) are added to the ‘interior_geom’ slot. The ‘unused_geom’ slot will contain all interior geometry that is completely unused. Lastly, ‘holes_geom’ contains edges and faces that were in the input and are part of the hull.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.

desc_content.paragraph: Makes the mesh elements in the “input” slot symmetrical. Unlike normal mirroring, it only copies in one direction, as specified by the “direction” slot. The edges and faces that cross the plane of symmetry are split as needed to enforce symmetry.
All new vertices, edges, and faces are added to the “geom.out” slot.

list_item.paragraph: bm (bmesh.types.BMesh) – The bmesh to operate on.
direction (enum in ['X', 'Y', 'Z'], default 'X') – axis to use
